title: 112_hr4064
content: The Act may be cited as the "Keeping Promises to Taxpayers Act of 2012" and the table of contents is provided. The "Keeping Promises to Taxpayers Act of 2012" includes the repeal of various taxes and fees related to healthcare, such as the employer health insurance mandate, excise taxes, limitations on health flexible spending arrangements, annual fees on health insurance providers, branded prescription pharmaceutical manufacturers, medical device manufacturers, and indoor tanning services. Repeal of tobacco product excise tax increase. SEC. 2. REPEAL OF EMPLOYER HEALTH INSURANCE MANDATE. The text chunk discusses the repeal of the employer health insurance mandate under Chapter 43 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, including the removal of section 4980H and related reporting requirements. Conforming amendments are made to various sections of the Code to reflect these changes. The amendments made include striking section 4980H and section 6056 from the Internal Revenue Code. Effective dates for these changes are specified, with some amendments taking effect after December 31, 2013, and others upon the enactment of the Act. SEC. 3. REPEAL OF EXCISE TAX ON HIGH COST EMPLOYER-SPONSORED HEALTH COVERAGE. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by removing section 4980I. SEC. 4. REPEAL OF OVER-THE-COUNTER DRUG LIMITATION. SEC. 4. REPEAL OF OVER-THE-COUNTER DRUG LIMITATION. Amendments are made to various sections of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, removing limitations on over-the-counter drugs for HSAs, Archer MSAs, Health Flexible Spending Arrangements, and Health Reimbursement Arrangements. Effective dates for these amendments are specified. Repeals are made to various sections of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act and the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, including the increase in medical expense threshold, limitation on health flexible spending arrangements, annual fee on health insurance providers, and annual fee on branded prescription pharmaceutical manufacturers and importers. SEC. 9. REPEAL OF EXCISE TAX ON MEDICAL DEVICE MANUFACTURERS. Repeals Subchapter E of chapter 32 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Conforming amendments are made to related sections. SEC. 10. REPEAL OF TAX ON INDOOR TANNING SERVICES. Repeals Chapter 49 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Effective date applies to services performed after enactment of this Act. SEC. 11. Repeals PCORTF and fees on insured and self-insured health plans. Trust Fund and fees under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 are repealed. Clerical amendments are made to related sections. SEC. 12. Repeals increase in additional tax on non-qualified distributions from HSAs and Archer MSAs. SEC. 13 amends the Internal Revenue Code to reduce the percentage from 20% to 10% for HSAs and Archer MSAs. The effective date for these changes applies to distributions made after the enactment of the Act. Additionally, SEC. 13 repeals the tobacco product excise tax increase. Each provision of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 amended by the Children's Health Insurance Program Reauthorization Act of 2009 is adjusted as if the amendment had never been enacted. A floor stocks refund is provided for tobacco products and cigarette papers held for sale on the date of enactment, crediting the taxpayer for excess taxes paid. The amendments made by this section apply to articles removed after the enactment of this Act, with specific rules for filing claims and definitions provided.
